sentences: La'Reonte Wright (born November 26, 1990), known professionally as Dizzy Wright, is an American rapper and record producer.
section: N/A

sentences: In December 2011, Wright signed to rapper Hopsin's independent record label, Funk Volume.
section: N/A

sentences: After signing, he released his debut studio album SmokeOut Conversations in April 2012.

sentences: He followed that with The First Agreement in December of that year, and then a mixtape The Golden Age in August 2013.
section: N/A

sentences: Following touring with Hopsin in early 2014, Dizzy Wright released State of Mind, an EP that would peak at number 54 on the Billboard 200.

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Wright looked up to Bone Thugs-n-Harmony, of which his uncles Layzie Bone and Flesh-N-Bone are members.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: At the age of four he moved with his mom and siblings to Las Vegas, Nevada.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He began rapping at just 8 years old with the group DaFuture which included his brother and a very close friend.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His mother wrote his raps at the time and was a concert promoter so he was exposed to the music industry early even doing youth reporting at major awards shows like the BET Awards and interviewing Tyrese, St. Lunatics and Boyz II Men.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He credits this for being the reason he wants to stay away from major record labels and stick to independent labels.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In seventh grade Wright lived in a homeless shelter with his family for five months.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Throughout the rest of high school he lived in Georgia and California before moving back to Las Vegas when he was in twelfth grade.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In 2010, Wright took part in and won the Sheikh Music Rip the Mic competition, which impressed record label Funk Volume.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: In 2010, he also appeared on 106 & Park's Wild Out Wednesday, as Dizzy D Flashy.

sentences: The Golden Age and State of Mind ===
section: == Musical career == | === 2013–2014: The Golden Age and State of Mind ===

sentences: On March 11, 2013, Wright released the first song from his upcoming mixtape, titled "Maintain" featuring fellow rapper Joey Bada$$. On March 26, it was announced that Wright would be included in XXL's Freshman Class of 2013 due to getting the "Peoples Choice" vote.
section: == Musical career == | === 2013–2014: The Golden Age and State of Mind ===

sentences: Three days later he would release the music video for a new song titled, "Still Movin'" which featured cameos from his Funk Volume label mates which was followed by "Killem Wit Kindness" a few days later.
section: == Musical career == | === 2013–2014: The Golden Age and State of Mind ===

sentences: These songs were the second and third releases from his upcoming mixtape, which was shortly announced to be titled, The Golden Age.
section: == Musical career == | === 2013–2014: The Golden Age and State of Mind ===

sentences: Guest appearances on the mixtape included Wyclef Jean, Hopsin, Joey Bada$$, Jarren Benton, SwizZz, Logic, Kid Ink and Honey Cocaine among others.

sentences: Along with production from DJ Hoppa, Rikio, Kato, 6ix, and Cardo.

sentences: The mixtape was released for free, and for purchase on iTunes on August 19, 2013.
section: == Musical career == | === 2013–2014: The Golden Age and State of Mind ===

sentences: In an interview with XXL the following month, Dizzy Wright said State of Mind had no current release date and confirmed his second studio album would be released during 2014.

sentences: State of Mind debuted at number 54 on the US Billboard 200 chart.

sentences: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: In February 2015, Wright released a collaborative mixtape with Mark Battles titled, Lost In Reality.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: On May 26, 2015, Wright released his second studio album, The Growing Process, which was released through Funk Volume and distributed by Warner Bros.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: The album went on and peaked at number 47 on the Billboard 200 chart.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: In January 2016, Funk Volume disbanded.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: On February 5, 2016, Wright released his first project post-Funk Volume titled, Wisdom and Good Vibes.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: On July 2, Wright released The 702 EP and was supported by two singles "East Side" and "What's In My Pot".
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: A few days after the release of the EP, Wright released a new single "They Know Why" commenting on controversial political issues.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: In November 2016, Wright released a collaborative mixtape with Demrick titled, Blaze With Us.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: On August 11, 2017, Wright released his third studio album The Golden Age 2 named after his 2013 mixtape The Golden Age.
section: == Musical career == | === 2015–2017: The Growing Process and multiple projects ===

sentences: On November 24, Wright released his fourth studio album, State of Mind 2, named after his 2014 extended play, State of Mind, with features from ILL Camille, Audio Push, Demrick, Larry June, Reezy, Jon Connor, A.D, and Chelle.
